understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getInternodeSocketSendBufferSizeInBytes which returns the value of a configuration parameter conf.internode_socket_send_buffer_size_in_bytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to setting the socket buffer size for internode communication. The configuration parameter conf.internode_socket_send_buffer_size_in_bytes is used to determine the socket send buffer size for internode communication.

config_description: Uncomment to set socket buffer size for internode communication Note that when setting this, the buffer size is limited by net.core.wmem_max and when not setting it it is defined by net.ipv4.tcp_wmem See also: /proc/sys/net/core/wmem_max /proc/sys/net/core/rmem_max /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_wmem /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_wmem and 'man tcp'
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code checks if the socketSendBufferSizeInBytes is not null, it returns the value of socketSendBufferSizeInBytes. If it is null, it returns the value from DatabaseDescriptor.getInternodeSocketSendBufferSizeInBytes().
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the socketSendBufferSizeInBytes is accessed in the code. The frequency of triggering depends on how often this method is called in the code.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Setting the socket buffer size for internode communication can impact the performance of the system. It can affect the network throughput and latency. It is important to consider the limits set by net.core.wmem_max and net.ipv4.tcp_wmem when configuring this option.
